thread.title: Whitening Purple Toothpaste - How to Color Correct Teeth
thread.title_full: Whitening Purple Toothpaste - How to Color Correct Teeth

author: Cosmopolitan.com
title: Whitening Purple Toothpaste - How to Color Correct Teeth
text:
Over the past few years, I've learned a ton of different tricks for using makeup to color correct: slathering green concealer on my face to counter redness , sweeping navy eyeshadow on the lids to make my eyes brighter , and coating my lips in clear gloss with blue undertones to make my teeth appear whiter. Color theory is such a powerful tool and when I learned of a purple-hued toothpaste for whitening, I needed it in my medicine cabinet like yesterday.
Advertisement - Continue Reading Below PopWhite is the brainchild of a pro makeup artist and dental scientist, both of whom wanted to created a natural toothcare line with purple color-correcting technology to gradually whiten teeth. What sets it apart, aside from its purple hue, is its lack of peroxide, a bleaching agent you'll find in most whitening products that can be harmful in excess. A safer, gentler alternative, I was totally on board for a two week trial. After all, violet shampoo has done wonders for keeping my blonde dye jobs brass-free.
New Year, New Oral Care! Add some COLOR to your routine!ðŸ’œ . #PowerOfPurple #WhiterBrighterSmile #ColorCorrection #TheNewWayToWhite #TheDentalCosmetic #NewYear #NewYearNewYou #resolution #2017 #POPWHITE #instagood #glam #mua #beautyblogger #bblogger #smile #teethwhitening #toothpaste #oralrinse #beautiful #fresh
A post shared by POPWHITEÂ® (@popwhitesmile) on Jan 10, 2017 at 9:19am PST
The Test Drive So for 14 days, in the morning and at night, I brushed my teeth with PopWhite's Whitening Primer + Toothpaste , as well as used their Whitening Toner + Oral Rinse, using my beloved electric Goby Tooth Brush . Two concerns I had from the get go were that I 1) wouldn't like the taste and 2) it'd turn my mouth purple as if I'd been popping grape-flavored Jolly Ranchers all day. As for the former, it wasn't as minty as my normal drugstore toothpaste, but it was 100% tolerable. The same goes for the mouthwash. And my tongue post lavender mouth cleanse? It was, in fact, purple. But only for a few minutes and then it went away.
These ladies are all dressed up and ready for their debut! #PrettyInPurple #POPWHITE #TheDentalCosmetic #WhiterBrighterSmiles
A post shared by POPWHITEÂ® (@popwhitesmile) on Dec 8, 2016 at 7:05pm PST
Advertisement - Continue Reading Below Results-wise, I started noticing a difference in my teeth after about a week. It was subtle, but my coffee addiction and predilection for red wine was less obvious i.e. my smile was a little whiter and brighterâ€“especially when I wore a lip color. And after two weeks, I really saw a difference, the boost it gave my go-to red, MAC's Ruby Woo , as the benchmark. It didn't make my computer-paper white per se, but I liked it that way. I was also pleased that there was no weird sensitivity either, which is something I've struggled with in other whitening treatments.
All in all, I have a new color-minded essential to add to my beauty routine and I'd recommend this stuff to anyone looking to give their smile some peroxide-free whitening love.
Before, During, and After using #POPWHITE's #PurpleToothpaste just ONE time!
A post shared by POPWHITEÂ® (@popwhitesmile) on Jan 19, 2017 at 4:21pm PST
PopWhite Whitening Primer + Toothpaste and Whitening Toner + Oral Rinse, $26; popwhitesmile.com .
From: Marie Claire
